channel.title: Do You Need To Portforward With Hamachi?

item.title: Do You Need To Portforward With Hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“kronixz, post:12, topic:419762”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=522297.msg3797636#msg3797636 date=1319765006]

Now go to your client and open up guy.java

It’s either in gui.java or client.java and is 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1

Dude it was a spellingn error…

I understand, but not all clients have gui.java, some have the ip in client.java.
[/quote]
Notice how I said “usually”[/quote]

But you didn’t give the other file it could be located at and you didn’t say usually.

Read full topic
item.source: Do You Need To Portforward With Hamachi?

item.title: Do You Need To Portforward With Hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

Ok so how to portfoward with hamachi

First start a group with user and pass in hamachi.

Then there’s going to be an IP in the hamachi group.

Now go to your client and open up gui.java it’s usually there.

Search for you current ip adress … Should be like

Change it to ur hamachi ip adress in ur server hamachi group

Read full topic
item.source: Do You Need To Portforward With Hamachi?
